definition: to have a lifeless look in one's eyes (idiom)

sentences.english: Pablo looked at him through his bleary eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他看上去目光呆滞，茫然若失。

sentences.english: A person regarded as mentally dull; a dolt.
sentences.chinese: 被认为迟钝的或呆滞的人。

sentences.english: The game got off to a sluggish start, but after half-time it fairly zipped along.
sentences.chinese: 比赛开始时有些呆滞，可是反半场的节奏却相当轻快。

sentences.english: Pablo looked at him through his bleary eyes .
sentences.chinese: 巴布罗那双目光呆滞的眼睛望着他。

sentences.english: However, flames of Ceiba flowers have burnt away all dullness in the fever, squanderingly.
sentences.chinese: 一朵一朵木棉花挥金如土般燃烧掉了高温里的呆滞。

sentences.english: Chinese growth rates are still miles off being negative or even sluggish.
sentences.chinese: 中国的增长率与消极或呆滞仍有一段距离。

sentences.english: When cats smell something and then open their mouth slightly and wrinkle their nose and lips they are exhibiting the characteristic of "flehming".
sentences.chinese: 就系当猫闻倒臭味时，个口会微微张开而神情呆滞。

sentences.english: Her dull black eyes fixed upon the gray cold face .
sentences.chinese: 她呆滞无神的黑眼珠盯在那张死灰冰冷的脸上。

sentences.english: Witnesses describe seeing him stumbling and looking glazed.
sentences.chinese: 目击证人称看见他脚步踉跄，神情呆滞。

sentences.english: Convulsions, thrashing about on the floor, glassy-eyed , foaming, rigid.
sentences.chinese: 惊厥，大约在地板上大胜，目光呆滞，发泡，僵化。

sentences.english: He’s not breathing and his eyes are glazed.
sentences.chinese: 他的呼吸停止，眼神呆滞。
所有人都表情呆滞，瘦弱不堪。

sentences.english: The dying man's eyes glazed over as he sank deeper into unconsciousness.
sentences.chinese: 那个快死的人愈加人事不省，他的目光也变得呆滞了。

sentences.english: All I could do was sit there and stare.
sentences.chinese: 我所能做的只是坐在那里，目光呆滞地看着。

definition: to have a lifeless look in one's eyes (idiom)
lit. dumb as a wooden chicken (idiom); fig. dumbstruck
to be surprised/to be amazed/to be stunned
